channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The Fed is expected to cut rates. And, Afghan CIA fighters feel abandoned by the U.S.
item.description: The divided Federal Reserve is considering cutting interest rates today. And, Afghans in the U.S. who fought for the CIA say they feel abandoned by the agency.
item.content:encoded:
The divided Federal Reserve is considering cutting interest rates today. And, Afghans in the U.S. who fought for the CIA say they feel abandoned by the agency.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Border Patrol left Charlotte. The damage stayed behind.
item.description: The Border Patrol's enforcement surge in Charlotte, N.C. lasted just about a week. Residents picking up the pieces in its aftermath say doing so is going to take a lot longer than that.
item.content:encoded:
The Border Patrol's enforcement surge in Charlotte, N.C. lasted just about a week. Residents picking up the pieces in its aftermath say doing so is going to take a lot longer than that.

(Image credit: Adrian Florido)
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Useful tips from NPR's most popular self-help stories of the year
item.description: A roundup of good advice from Life Kit's 10 most read stories of 2025. Find out which foods support better sleep, how to be happier and how to graciously accept compliments.
item.content:encoded: A roundup of good advice from Life Kit's 10 most read stories of 2025. Find out which foods support better sleep, how to be happier and how to graciously accept compliments.
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: Trump's SAVE tool is looking for noncitizen voters. But it's flagging U.S. citizens too
item.description: Anthony Nel, of Texas, became a U.S. citizen as a teen. But a flaw in a Trump administration citizenship tool flagged him as a potential noncitizen, which led to his voter registration being canceled.
item.content:encoded: Anthony Nel, of Texas, became a U.S. citizen as a teen. But a flaw in a Trump administration citizenship tool flagged him as a potential noncitizen, which led to his voter registration being canceled.
item.dc:creator: Jude Joffe-Block

item.title: How Trump is remaking one agency to aid his deportation push
item.description: The Trump administration's changes to U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services are taking an axe to the agency's traditional mission of ensuring people lawfully immigrate and stay in the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration's changes to U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services are taking an axe to the agency's traditional mission of ensuring people lawfully immigrate and stay in the U.S.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Education Department recalls fired attorneys amid civil rights complaint backlog
item.description: The department said recalling these fired staffers would "bolster and refocus" civil rights enforcement "in a way that serves and benefits parents, students, and families."
item.content:encoded:
The department said recalling these fired staffers would "bolster and refocus" civil rights enforcement "in a way that serves and benefits parents, students, and families."

(Image credit: Bill Clark)
item.dc:creator: Cory Turner

item.title: Feeling burned out? There's a word for that in Mandarin Chinese
item.description: How an obscure term used in anthropology leaped from the pages of academia into the Chinese meme world and then became part of Chinese government policymaking.
item.content:encoded: How an obscure term used in anthropology leaped from the pages of academia into the Chinese meme world and then became part of Chinese government policymaking.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Brett Cooper says she makes up her own mind — about Trump and everything else
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks conservative commentator Brett Cooper about her YouTube following, her recent criticisms of President Trump and her opinion of Nick Fuentes.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks conservative commentator Brett Cooper about her YouTube following, her recent criticisms of President Trump and her opinion of Nick Fuentes.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: A divided Fed is expected to cut rates for a 3rd straight time
item.description: The Fed is expected to lower its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point — but with inflation stubbornly high and mixed signals from the job market, it could be a split decision.
item.content:encoded:
The Fed is expected to lower its benchmark interest rate by a quarter percentage point — but with inflation stubbornly high and mixed signals from the job market, it could be a split decision.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Afghan CIA fighters, like National Guard attack suspect, face stark reality in U.S.
item.description: The fighters led by the CIA found themselves spiraling into despair because of what they saw as bureaucratic neglect and abandonment by the U.S. government. Among their ranks was Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the man charged with killing one National Guard soldier and seriously injuring a second after opening fire on them in Washington, D.C. on Thanksgiving Eve.
item.content:encoded:
The fighters led by the CIA found themselves spiraling into despair because of what they saw as bureaucratic neglect and abandonment by the U.S. government. Among their ranks was Rahmanullah Lakanwal, the man charged with killing one National Guard soldier and seriously injuring a second after opening fire on them in Washington, D.C. on Thanksgiving Eve.

(Image credit: Nathan Howard)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
